description: The tightening of criteria for residency in France has led to a 42% drop in the amount of permits given out over the first nine months of the year.

headline: For the future French aircraft carrier, Macron announces new ship 'in an era of predators'
description: Emmanuel Macron has confirmed the construction of a replacement for the 'Charles-de-Gaulle' aircraft carrier, set to enter service in 2038. With a crew of 2,000 sailors, the new ship will be able to carry 30 fighter jets, several types of aerial drones and numerous electronic warfare systems.

headline: British singer Chris Rea, known for 'Driving Home for Christmas,' dies at 74
description: The singer-songwriter 'passed away peacefully in hospital earlier today following a short illness,' his family said in a press release on Monday.

headline: Six Louvre masterpieces we're glad weren't stolen in the heist
description: Following the dramatic October theft at the world's largest museum, Le Monde in English journalists reflected on our favorite objects housed in the Paris institution.

Disneyland Paris at 40: When Mickey Mouse said 'bonjour' to Paris
description: On December 18, 1985, the Walt Disney Company approved the construction of its first European theme park in Marne-la-Vallée, about 30 kilometers east of Paris. The prime minister secured the deal after tough negotiations between envoys from the Socialist government and an American corporation seen as the embodiment of ruthless capitalism.

headline: Madagascar's metalheads lead charge of anger: 'It's easier to make yourself heard when you scream'
description: After three weeks of protest, Madagascar's Generation Z succeeded in toppling those in power on October 14. The uprising drew much of its strength from countercultural circles, chief among them the island's vibrant metal scene. Heirs to a long tradition, Madagascar's metalheads condemn poverty, inequality and the regime's incompetence.

headline: Da Vinci's secret tunnels at Milan's Sforza Castle appear to be nothing more than sewers
description: Researchers from the Politecnico di Milano claim to have discovered mysterious underground passages beneath the medieval fortress that match sketches by the Italian master. But historians specializing in the period sharply dispute this theory.
